result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jose A Villarreal was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence immediately.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

11:32. Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared on behalf of Defendant, Jose A Villarreal.  Attorney Gilbert G. Thompson appears on behalf of the State.  Court heard.  Attorney Mayer heard regarding his motion.  Court will neither grant/deny motion, held open until further notice from Atty Mayer.
Motion hearing on January 9, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Order on Arraignment

Defendant Jose A Villarreal in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; parties heard on bond; Court denies mtn to modify bond;  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

(8:17)  State of WI apprs by Atty Jim Sempf; by phone means.  DEF, Jose Villarreal apprs in person; in custody w/o coun.  Discussion held.  Court will contact Public Defender. Off record.  Atty Moeller will contact DEF.  Set for another review hearing.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

10:32 - Defendant, Jose A Villarreal in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. New address given in TX. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $10,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.
